https://www.linkedin.com/company/nsha/
https://twitter.com/healthns

Position Summary::

The Government Programs & Government Relations Team leads the organization’s growth efforts by engaging with States to promote and expand Seniorlink’s services within identified markets. The Director, Government Relations will collaborate with key internal stakeholders to evolve the company’s State-level government relations strategy for partnering with Medicaid and related State agencies. This includes effectively managing our local lobbying relationships and advancing the efficacy of our advocacy programs to advance home and community-based services that support Medicaid members and family caregivers.
What You Will Do::
Research, analyze and monitor current and future industry trends, regulatory, environmental and competitive conditions generally and in identified markets; recommend appropriate government relations actions or solutions to preserve and/or grow a favorable contracting environment
Develop and implement the company’s State engagement strategy, prioritizing the necessary activities and efforts specific to support the organization’s policy objectives and growth agenda
Implement ongoing advocacy and engagement plans proactively and efficiently to ensure positive and productive relations with State officials and collaborate with other like-minded organizations on advocacy efforts, when appropriate
Advance the organization’s advocacy agenda through development of appropriate support materials and testimonials, recruitment of local spokespersons, and other activities
In coordination with local lobbyists, where retained, meet with members of State legislatures, their staff and other State government officials
Establish and maintain trusted and productive relationships with local lobbyists, to ensure performance expectations are met concerning the State-level work for which they are contracted; identify and coordinate best practices amongst the network of lobbyists and consultants to drive continuous improvement
Develop and present reports to update leadership on progress, business learnings, and market trends
Perform other duties as assigned
What You Will Bring::
8+ years’ experience in the healthcare, finance, or social services industry in a government relations, legislative or regulatory lobbying role; Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
5+ years of proven experience building and managing issue advocacy initiatives
A working knowledge of Medicaid programs including Medicaid LTSS is preferred
Ability to work independently, as a part of a small team, and in larger cross-functional project teams
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation),
Policy analysis and technical (legislative and regulatory) writing skills
An entrepreneurial and optimistic mindset
Ability to travel routinely (when safe to do so); travel will be planned and predictable
About Us::

Seniorlink is a tech-enabled care management company dedicated to supporting family caregivers who help to keep care at home. Seniorlink combines Vela, the company’s proprietary care collaboration app, with evidence-based clinical protocols and the human touch of dedicated care teams that work in partnership with family caregivers. Seniorlink's care management solutions lead to improved outcomes, cost savings and improved consumer engagement and satisfaction for health plans and providers.
For more information, please visit www.Seniorlink.com.
Seniorlink is an Equal Opportunity Employer*
DISCLAIMER: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.
Seniorlink supports families with diverse backgrounds and as an equal opportunity employer, we seek employees who reflect the diverse population we serve. Seniorlink complies with all applicable laws concerning hiring and employment practices and is firmly committed to fostering and maintaining a workplace free from discrimination. We pledge to hire, train, and promote our employees without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, genetic information, age, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable law.
Seniorlink strives to create experiences that are accessible and welcoming to everyone, including making www.seniorlink.com and the careers site accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the company’s diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives, inquire about a specific accessibility need or the accessibility of our website, or if you need assistance completing an application process, please contact People & Culture at 866-797-2333.
